title: Chlorine with a relative atomic mass of 35.5 contains two isotopes, what is the relative abundance of each isotope in the sample of chlorine? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are 25- isotopes of Chlorine with the Atomic Mass ranging from 26 to 52. But only 2-isotopes of Chlorine with Atomic Mass of 35 and 37 are prominent with the relative abundance of 74% and 26% respectively. Hence the atomic Mass of Chlorine Atom is [(35 x 0.74) + (37 x 0.24)]÷100= 35.457. So the relative abundance Cl-35 and Cl-37 are in the ratio of 0.74:0.24= 3:1 Among the various isotopes of Chlorine, Cl-36, is relatively stable with an half- life of 3.08 x 10^5 years. All other isotopes of Chlorine are radio active with very very short Half-Life.
Cl(35) has a % occurrence of 75.8% Co(37) has a % occurrence of 24.2%
